text: Chromolucuma is a genus of plants in the family Sapotaceae described in 1925.Ducke, Walter Adolpho. 1925. Archivos do Jardim Botânico do Rio de Janeiro 4: 160-161 descriptions in Latin, commentary in FrenchTropicos, Chromolucuma DuckeGovaerts, R., Frodin, D.G. & Pennington, D. (2001 publ. 2002). World Checklist and Bibliography of Sapotaceae: 1-364. The Board of Trustees of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew. The genus is native to Central and South America.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesPennington, T. D. 1990. Sapotaceae. Flora Neotropica, Monograph 52: 1–771. ;Species # Chromolucuma apiculata Alves-Araújo & M.Alves \- Bahia # Chromolucuma baehniana Monach \- Venezuela (Amazonas), Guyana # Chromolucuma congestifolia (Pilz) Alves-Araújo & M.Alves \- Panama, Costa Rica # Chromolucuma rubriflora Ducke \- Colombia (Antioquia), S Venezuela (Amazonas), Brazil (Amazonas, Roraima, Pará) ==References== Category:Sapotaceae genera Category:Chrysophylloideae
title: Chromolucuma
